results.title: The Squatter's Daughter
results.brief_description: In his second feature production, Ken Hall retained little but the title of the old play by Bailey and Duggan which had been more faithfully filmed in 1910. Hall’s film focussed on the rivalry between two sheep stations, one managed by a strong willed woman, Joan Enderby and the other by a weak willed enemy, Clive Sherrington. Hall believed in providing light relief in his dramas and the film introduced some of his most effective comedy sequences. Strong nationalistic sentiment pervades the film, with Frank Hurley’s photography of the outback capturing some vistas of impressive grandeur. Cast includes Jocelyn Howarth, Dick Fair, John Warwick, Fred MacDonald.
results.description:
In his second feature production, Ken Hall retained little but the title of the old play by Bailey and Duggan, which had been more faithfully filmed in 1910. Hall’s film focused on the rivalry between two sheep stations; one managed by a strong willed woman, Joan Enderby, and the other by a weak-willed enemy, Clive Sherrington.

Hall believed in providing light relief in his dramas and the film introduced some of his most effective comedy sequences. Strong nationalistic sentiment pervades the film, with Frank Hurley’s photography of the Outback capturing some vistas of impressive grandeur.

Cast includes Jocelyn Howarth, Dick Fair, John Warwick, Fred MacDonald.

results.title: The Back of Beyond
results.creator_credit: John Heyer, Shell Film Unit, Janet Heyer and Roland Robinson
results.brief_description: Heyer’s romantic impression of life in the inland of Australia featuring the Birdsville Track and its postman, Tom Kruse. Highlights the isolation of the people on outback stations and small towns, and the importance in their lives of the postman and the pedal wireless. Notable in the history of documentary for its strong visuals and use of natural speech, and for being the first production of the Shell Film Unit in Australia. Commentary spoken by Kevin Brennan.

results.title: Peeping Tom
results.creator_credit: Michael Powell and Michael Powell (Theatre) Ltd
results.brief_description: A withdrawn psychopath films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. Now considered a masterpiece, Michael Powell’s film foreshadowed the slasher genre.

constellations_other.name: Capturing first-person POV
constellations_other.description: A comparison of how videogames and feature films have used first person POV shots and sequences and how (for the latter) camera technology has impacted on this.

results.description: In 1960 “Peeping Tom” took a ferocious drubbing from the English critical establishment. Powell saw it not as a horror film but ‘a film of compassion, of observation and of memory … a film about the cinema from 1900 to 1960 … the opposite to a realistic film … a reverie’. A withdrawn psychopath, traumatised by childhood memories, films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. This is rendered genuinely disturbing as we are drawn into identification with the protagonist through Carl Boehm’s subtly controlled performance. Littered with internal cross references, this is a reflexively subversive film about the fascination of cinema, a film which seeks to make voyeurs of us all. Cast also includes Moira Shearer, Anna Massey and Maxine Audley.
description_for_label: In 1960 “Peeping Tom” took a ferocious drubbing from the English critical establishment. Powell saw it not as a horror film but ‘a film of compassion, of observation and of memory … a film about the cinema from 1900 to 1960 … the opposite to a realistic film … a reverie’. A withdrawn psychopath, traumatised by childhood memories, films young women as he impales them with the camera’s tripod, forcing them to watch their own death throes in a mirror mounted on the camera. This is rendered genuinely disturbing as we are drawn into identification with the protagonist through Carl Boehm’s subtly controlled performance. Littered with internal cross references, this is a reflexively subversive film about the fascination of cinema, a film which seeks to make voyeurs of us all. Cast also includes Moira Shearer, Anna Massey and Maxine Audley.

results.title: Bertolucci shoots 1900
results.creator_credit: Gianni Amelio, Luca Olmastroni and Daria Cinematografica
results.brief_description: A documentary made during the shooting of Bertolucci’s “Novocento” which includes comments by Bertolucci on his attitudes to film-making as well as reflecting the particular style of this film-maker. Highlights the role of the director, his relationship with the crew and points to various film-making techniques by showing the shooting of specific scenes. Suitable for Upper Secondary-Tertiary level students.

results.title: The Battle of Midway
results.creator_credit: John Ford and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Why we fight”.
John Ford’s Academy Award winning documentary filmed during the Battle of Midway. Narration combines with visuals of the naval air battle, hospitalization of the injured and burial services in a patriotic tribute to the people from the United States battling the Japanese. Suitable for Tertiary level students.

results.title: Pool sharks
results.creator_credit: Edwin Middleton, Essex Films and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: W.C. Fields’ first film displaying his prowess at the pool table; rivals for the same girl find that a “friendly” game does not help to settle the matter. A useful comparison with later films in terms of the development of character, history of comedy and the role of women. Written by W.C. Fields and musical score by Stuart Oderman.

results.title: The Care we take
results.creator_credit: Tim Sullivan, Bruce Moir, Film House Company and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive look at the Australian barley industry in South Australia and Victoria as controlled by the Australian Barley Board. Deals with all aspects from research and growing to marketing and final uses of barley. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Interviews with My Lai veterans
results.creator_credit: Joseph Strick and Laser Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Five American soldiers present their recollections of the events at My Lai, Vietnam on 16th March 1968. During their interviews such matters as the training of soldiers, the strategy of My Lai and the details of the massacre are discussed. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
